alert.note: Alert for Adams; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 13 at 1:21PM CDT until May 13 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Lincoln County in south central Mississippi... Jefferson County in southwestern Mississippi... Franklin County in southwestern Mississippi... Northeastern Adams County in southwestern Mississippi... Southwestern Copiah County in central Mississippi... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 121 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glancy to New Hope to near Alcorn, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... New Hope around 125 PM CDT. Fayette and Kirby around 135 PM CDT. Bude and Church Hill around 140 PM CDT. Loyd Star and Stampley around 155 PM CDT. Stanton around 200 PM CDT. Vaughn around 205 PM CDT. Cranfield around 215 PM CDT. West Lincoln around 220 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Roxie and Meadville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
